definition: lie/false words/nonsense/CL:篇[pian1]
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to tell one lie after another (idiom)/to talk nonsense/bogus story
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
containing_words.word: 見人說人話，見鬼說鬼話

sentences.english: There was all the usual humbug and obligatory compliments from ministers.
sentences.chinese: 全都是些部長們常說的騙人鬼話和少不了的奉承恭維。

sentences.english: You seem perfectly willing to accept this nonsense, Jodl.
sentences.chinese: 你似乎完全願意接受這種鬼話，約德爾。

sentences.english: Do you think I will believe such a story agian?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲我還會相信這樣的鬼話嗎？

sentences.english: Only you believe his total nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 他的一劃鬼話，只有你還相信。

sentences.english: He told us some cock -and-bull story about having lost all his money.
sentences.chinese: 他鬼話連篇，告訴我們把錢都丟了。

sentences.english: Might as well get that out of your 22 year old head right now.
sentences.chinese: 最好把那些鬼話從你22歲的腦瓜裏清除掉。

sentences.english: We tell each other the most absurd stories with the most serious faces.
sentences.chinese: 我們裝着最正經的面孔，彼此說些最荒誕不徑的鬼話。

sentences.english: What on earth are you talking about?
I am going to expose all this humbug.
sentences.chinese: 我要揭露這一切騙人的鬼話。

sentences.english: What the devil am I to write to that good old soul?
sentences.chinese: 我得對她寫些什麼鬼話呢，對那個好老太婆？

sentences.english: This yer religion is all a mess of lying trumpery, Tom.
sentences.chinese: 宗教這玩意兒全是騙人的鬼話，湯姆。

sentences.english: He even seems to have got over most of his Pureblood Supremacy bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至都好像已經忘記了那套純血統最高的鬼話。

sentences.english: What he said is deceitful words.
The basement of this building is said to be haunted,but it is just a bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 有人說我們這棟樓的地下室鬧鬼，這只不過是鬼話。

sentences.english: I'm too smart to believe in that kind of old wives' tale.
sentences.chinese: 我纔不會傻到相信那種老媽子的鬼話。

definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
a lie/untrue statement/misstatement
lie
to feel disheartened
unlucky
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
